intro: A great place for coffee and breakfast run out of a garage
A cozy bistro serving excellent coffee and multi-cuisine comfort food.
Ramen Misoya is Colombo's only Japanese restaurant that specializes in miso-based ramen. They've got a small menu that they nail quite well along with a surprisingly brilliant fried rice.
bed and breakfast with cabanas on a relatively isolated patch of beach
Great simple Sri Lankan and fusion/international food on Hiriketiya beach.
A small gem in the busy Kandy streets serving some great coffee and deliciously sweet treats.
Great please to have a delicious Chinese, Thai dinner freely

The Sahan Agro organic shop at Economic Center has a dessert parlour down Jambugasmulla Mawatha, Nugegoda. They dishes out a range of strawberry based snacks, drinks  and other natural products like bee honey.
Great pizza place in Hiri with rather slow service.
A pitstop to refresh yourself with a fine cup of tea on your way to Kandy.
Dwell Sri Lanka's Japanese inspired cafe where you can enjoy great food within a relaxed space.

address: Yala National Park, Kirinda - Sithulpawwa road, Thissamaharamaya
intro: An incredibly beautiful luxury campsite which is a treat for eco-lovers, birdwatchers, and people who enjoy genuine rusticity.
restaurant: Podi Hoona - The Little Gecko Luxury Campsite

intro: A restaurant and pub that serves some excellent dishes.
Your ideal place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch, which is both healthy and freshly made.
A greatly underrated place serving some of the best lamprais we have had. Highly recommend you check it out!

address: No. 5, Church Cross Street, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: With its colonial elegance, comfortable accommodation, well trained staff, and the excellent food, The Bungalow - Galle Fort is a place that unites every bit of happiness that you're looking for in Galle.
Chinese Delight is one of Colombo's many, many Chinese eateries. They've got great Chinese food for an affordable price tag, with the nicest service.
A beautiful cottage hotel that provides the genuine jungle experience nestled in the wilderness of Beragala.
Hasara Kitchen is a popular spot in Nugegoda, that dishes out some okay rice and curry for a decent price tag.
Havi at Pannipitiya is a good spot to chill with some booze, and delicious black pepper pork.

address: 758A, Dr. Danister de Silva Mawatha, Colombo 09
intro: The newest bubble tea joint in Colombo. They also do cakes, burgers, waffles and sandwiches.
Navro Beach is one of the most popular restaurants in Panadura area, if you want to have a relaxed evening with some drinks and delicious food.
A tiny food joint down Albert Place, Dehiwala that serves up some good street food for very cheap prices.
A cafe that seems to have Australian inspired dishes, as well as local delicacies. Only on paper, as it turned out.
Meat & Co. is a home cook who grills some decent steaks at very reasonable prices
An authentic and casual Japanese revamp of Work In Progress. Worth a try.

address: Siam View Hotel, Panama Road, Arugam Bay
intro: Zephyr is a branch of the Mirissa spot. They do quite good food and drinks here.
Fab is one of the older and more established bakeries in town. The franchise is well known for its cakes.
පානදුර පැත්තෙ ගියපු වෙලාවක රසම රස කෑම ටිකක් හිතේ හැටියට තෝරගෙන බඩ පැලෙනකන් කන්න කැම්රෝස් අවන්හල නම් කියාපු තැනක් තමයි.
A lawyer's chambers turned Moroccan/Italian restaurant, they do their own take on moussaka, hummus and baba ghanoush.
Royal Bakery is an old timer from Colombo's original bakery scene, going way back to 1906. The shorteats and cakes are still pretty good, and they've expanded to serving rice and kottu too.

address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
intro: The sushi bar at the Cinnamon Lakeside lobby is actually a great place for an authentic Japanese meal for very affordable prices.

Shandong is a new Chinese restaurant in Rajagiriya, spearheaded by a few Industry veterans. They're one of the better choices when it comes to Sri Lankan Chinese delivery, though certain areas have plenty of room for improvement.

address: No. 98, Sri Saranankara Road, Kalubowila, Dehiwala
intro: If you thought you'd tried the entire local burger monarchy, think again, cause we just found Burger Queen. It may not blow your mind, but they've got some interesting additions along with the usual favourites.
The Kandos Shop is a super cheap, one-stop-for-all candy shop, featuring one of Sri Lanka's oldest chocolate brands. It's an ideal stop for kids and gift shopping.
Diwan is a new multi-cuisine restaurant on Sri Saranankara Road. It's mostly known for it's Indian cuisine, which is what we tried, but they also offer Chinese and Italian.
Red Orchids is like the new Flower Drum, with the same staff and waiters, and again they do tasty classic Sri Lankanized Chinese food at affordable rates.
China Town is a little restaurant on Marine Drive that serves big sloppy portions of spicy Sri Lankan-Chinese and even some Indian.

address: 536/15, Wijesinghe Gardens,  Kotte Road, Pita Kotte
intro: Affordable and pretty tasty office lunches, with free delivery.
Sugar Bistro Galle Fort is a smaller rendition of Sugar Bistro and Wine Bar in Colombo, serving the same great food and drank at a stylish new address at the Galle Dutch Hospital.

address: Urban Wetland Park, 100 Nawala Rd, Nugegoda
intro: Garton's Ark is a floating (boat) restaurant in the Nugegoda Wetlands Park.

address: Mount Lavinia beach, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia
intro: Rasa Malaysia is a relatively new restaurant down the Mount Lavinia beach stretch, alongside common beach food names like Steam Boat and Loon Tao. The ambience by the beach is obviously awesome, and the food is alright - but we fell in love with their hot butter cuttlefish.
Semondu is Sri Lankan airlines' attempt at semi-fine dining (yup, that's a word now). They serve up continental fusion cuisine, and for the most part, they do it well.
Skrumptious has introduced a new flavour to their lineup of brownies. We tried it, and it's pretty darn great.

address: Stall No.146, Good Market ,Diyatha Uyana, Battaramulla
intro: Dushy's at the Good Market (Diyatha Uyana) is a small new stall that sells yummy organic health food. We tried out what they had, and we left stuffed, and not feeling guilty for a change!

Peach Valley is an old favourite when it comes to Sri Lankanized Chinese in Colombo. While the food itself hasn't changed much the recent renovations have done a great deal to help the look and feel of the place.
Ginger's a small Bistro that offers a mix of Asian Flavours. They've got a cozy space with some nice curry dishes, but are also quite pricey.

address: Arcade Independence Square, Clock Tower 1st Floor, Independence Square, Colombo 7
intro: Over a year since first opening its doors Tsukiji Uoichi is still going strong. They've got one of the most impressive Japanese menus in Colombo and they're execution is excellent. Their prices are on the higher end but the food is well worth it and the service is as efficient as it gets.

Ever been to one of those places where you ate so much, you had to just stop and rest a bit? Those kind of places are harder to come by now since food in general is too expensive, but at long last we found another in Chennai restaurant. You can pretty much stuff your face full of tasty Indian dishes and it'll cost you less than Rs.400, guaranteed.
Xilaton is a Chinese restaurant in Bambalapitiya - the service is good and so is the food. We're especially fans of their hot garlic prawns which - get this - are slathered in cheese.

The Boulevard, formerly a cafe/restuarant, has been completely revamped into what we'd consider one of the top Thai restaurants in Colombo. With chef Mama (former head chef at Royal Thai) at the fore, as well as some outstanding food, this is one place to keep an eye on.
The new Kaema Sutra, moved from its previous premises in Arcade Independence to the plush Shangri La, still serves decent-ish food at high prices

Since the only proper food courts we've had in the city have been at Crescat, Excel World, Liberty and Majestic City - it's with great relief that we welcome the new one at the brand spanking new Arcade Independence Square. We think the atmosphere especially and the food here is a little notch above that of your average Colombo food court.

Cafe Orange Peel is less of a cafe and more of a very sophisticated bath-kadey - it is a popular new stop for the working crowd in Bambalapitiya. Their rice and curry is top class and comes in epic portions.

Empire Cafe is a little restaurant-cum-cafe housed inside the Olde Empire Hotel, a 200 year old building, right next to the Dalada Maligawa in Kandy. It's a popular tourist hangout, is surprisingly affordable, and has the best chocolate cake we've had in ages.

address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
intro: The Governor's Restaurant at Mt.Lavinia Hotel offers one of the better buffets in the city. We found that mostly everything tasted good, with an exceptional salad bar and arguably the best selection of desserts around.
Tang Dynasty  is one of the most authentic ones we've been to, the interior is amazing and the food is top notch.
Sigiri is a small but excellent Sri Lankan restaurant located in Manhattan, New York serving an authentic and impressive representation of Lankan cuisine.

Drunken Monkey is a popular restaurant and bar in Hikkaduwa, and one of the couple of places that still function during off-season. The food is average but it's a great place to hang out by the beach.
Cafe Asiana is an established affordable restaurant down Hill Street that, as the name suggests, serves Sri Lankanized Asian food - their portions are huge and their seafood is spicy and delicious.

address: 347, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
intro: Swift service and healthy veggie options make Subway a worthy new franchise in Colombo.

Pedlar's Inn Cafe is a popular stop in Galle fort (and so is their Gelato opposite the cafe) - the food is alright, but mostly it's the ambience that makes this place appealing, though there are better spots with better food in the Fort these days.
We've seen their brownies pop up on our news feed more than a few times.  So this time we made it a point to give Treats n Stuff a shot.  We can now see why they've got such a large following.
Queen's Cafe is a very popular fast food stop down Duplication Road that's been around for ages. It was closed for a while awaiting a face lift, but it's now open for business again.
The Bread Company does excellent breads, sausages, pickles and more, and they do some of the  best sandwiches in the city and a good breakfast if you want to dine in.
Quick Thai serves up a range of affordable Thai dishes that are low on refinement, yet big on taste, from its modest, but elegant Pelawatta premises.
Domenico's, headed by the former chef at Santoré was great addition to Colombo's pizza scene in 2014. Now they've expanded their menu with some much needed meats and it's that much better.

address: 450/B, Charles Drive, off Duplication Road, Colombo 3
intro: Chinese Juchunyuan in Colpetty is one of the few places in town to try out Chinese hotpot. The catch, however, is that if you don't add the right ingredients to the hotpot you'll basically end up drinking broth. On the flipside, it can also be excellent should you make it right.
The New Saraswati Cafe in Pettah is a popular little restaurant that serves good (and plenty of) vegetarian South Indian food, for cheap saivar kades prices.
Kebabish is a new street side restaurant in Dehiwala that offers South Asian and Mediterranean cuisine. They maybe a small place but their big on taste.

address: 399, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 3
intro: Garden Cafe is an awesome little tea lounge hiding behind a Noritake store in Duplication Road. They serve neat tall glasses of chilled tea, not to mention smoothies and brownies, and the prices are low.
Navayuga is a pretty nice Indian restauran. Set inside what seems to have once been a charming house, it's cosy, and their menu is pretty wide.

Jack Tree's food is pretty tasty, if you eat here you're probably going to eat till it hurts a little to walk. It is however, pricey. Is it authentic Thai? We didn't think so, you get food here that the Sri Lankan palate is quite used to.

Kandy Muslim Hotel is not a hotel, but it's a very popular stop for biriyani, kottu and the likes, down the main street at Kandy's center. It's a much bigger, cleaner version of a Colombo kottu kade, and the food is actually pretty good and doesn't cost a lot.

address: Shop No. 4, Arcade Independence Square, Colombo 7
intro: Dilmah t-Lounge at the Arcade is pretty similar to their outlet in Chatham Street. The food is good, and the space is less crowded but the service isn't great.

Zion Fountain Cafe is a little bath kade type eatery that's on the same premises as the Zion Christian Church. They serve rice, short-eats, smoothies and cake for affordable prices, and it's actually a pretty popular stop for school-goers in the neighborhood.

Wonderland is an ice cream and smoothie joint in Malabe that has a huge range of stuff on their menu, and it's quite cheap too. Their smoothie glasses are tall and they've got cool flavours like Milo and bubblegum. It is all the way in Malabe though, so all you people in central Colombo, suck it up.

From what we experienced, the Baskin Robbins on Galle Road is run-down and not a good value for money. They managed to disappoint us in pretty much every department, while charging us Rs. 1400 for a three scoop sundae and milkshake.

address: 316, Polduwa Rd, Ethul Kotte Road, Battaramulla
intro: Pranzo has an amazing view and serves pretty good Italian and 'Sritalian' fare.
Aahaara is a caterer that does wood-fired biriyani and rice and curry.

Consider yourself a bona fide carnivore? Well then Backyard BBQ is just what you're looking for. They're a barbecue specialist in Mt.Lavinia that does delivery and take-out. They've got a great selection of western barbecue at a pretty good price.
Theva Cuisine is of Kandy's few good restaurants. With great breads, excellent dessert and friendly service, it's definitely worth a visit.
Monster Cookies is a home baker that does a variety of cookies and since of late, brownies as well. We tried out some of their more interesting choices and we were all smiles.
Agra is another one of those rare fine dining Indian restaurants in Colombo. They're not cheap but we think their food is definitely worth the price.
Chana's has been gaining popularity for sometime now and it's easy to see why. They do a pretty good take on North Indian cuisine and their biriyani is one of the best in town.
Kandoori is an Indian restaurant that serves just biriyani and other Indian food.

For those looking for healthy food in Colombo, the choices are limited, but The Salad Bar in Rajagiriya is looking to change that. They're a tiny stall that offers a range of salads at affordable rates. The best part is that they actually deliver.

Colombo has a ton of Chinese eateries, but Tong Ni BBQ hidden away on Walukarama Road (behind Subway), is one that is truly unique. The food is good and you get to see it being cooked right on your table. It may not suit everyone but we found it entertaining.

The grandly named New Star Hotel is a little street kade on the Galle Road of Dehiwala that serves up a mean iced milo, biriyani and kottu. It's a good stop for a cheap, tasty lunch, if you don't mind the dodginess.

Good Market isn't just once a week anymore. Besides at Diyatha Uyana (Thursdays) and Racecourse (Saturdays), you can now get Good Market's fresh, organic food straight from local vendors, on Lakpahana premises.

Huasui is yet another Chinese restaurant to join the many we've got in Colombo. The ambience is pretty pleasant and the food is nothing amazing compared to the flavour and portions in other Chinese restaurants, but it is good.
Three years after opening Asylum has upped its food and service game
Rather greasy and heavy food.
Cremalato is a local gelato manufacturer that actually delivers frozen confections.  We tried a bunch of their new flavours and we think they're pretty awesome.
Arthur's pizza is now a pub, too. They do their own take on localised pizza.
Off The Hook is a fresh seafood restaurant and bar  located on Park Road run by the same management as The Bavarian German Restaurant.

So among all the delivery joints thankfully cropping up in Colombo for the benefit of those of us who want to eat lazily at home, Choco Luv has made itself known as an unlikely contender in the realm of pizza delivery.
Bilal Hotel is a little kade on Bamba's Galle Road that serves kottu, fried rice, biriyani and the likes. The prices are low and the kottu is super cheesey.
Buth Amma's Buth Kade is a hole-in-the-wall rice and curry spot in Bamba, run out of a family home for 68 years.
Pink Sugar is a new home baker which remixes classic flavors like  Oreo, Ferrero Rocher and Irish cream.
Tea Avenue is a very cosy stop on Barnes Place to have a good cup of flavoured tea and some bready goods. The prices are good and the ambience is suited for all kinds of meetups.

address: Arpico Super Store, 69, Hyde Park Corner, Colombo 02
intro: Frozen is a 'gourmet' ice cream place at Urban Kitchen. The prices are fine and they've got some interesting options on their menu.
Prego is an Italian restaurant in Negombo. Although the prices are high, the food is quite authentic and the ambience is chilled out.
Icebear Century Café is a very cool place to chill out at in Negombo - it's a quirky hangout and novelty shop in an old house.

address: 15A, Robert Road, off Quarry Road, Dehiwala
intro: CuppaCrème is a home baker who is amazing at choc biscuit pudding and red velvet cupcakes.
The Sweet Tooth or TST, is a small home baker that specializes in jars full of baked goods. We tried a bunch of different jars (along with some other stuff) and they were all pretty great.
A little rooftop spot in the Fort serving up a variety of crepes.
Giovanni's is a little Italian pizza place run by a chef who uses his own recipes, and serves fresh from a clay oven.
The Sweeter Side is another home baker - the prices are fine, the cakes are a bit bread-texture, we like the fudge brownies.
The Fab Cafe, the coffee lounge by The Fab is relatively unknown cafe down Castle street. They've got a chic space and some great Hot chocolate.
Top Secret is a very cool beach hangout in Hikkaduwa. We loved the ambience and the food is good without  being too pricey.
Pizza Hut's stuff isn't half bad, and their desserts are actually quite great, but the portions don't justify the prices.

Ambrosia does baked goodies, but they're not a home baker. They're a company, but the stuff we had was made by a very skilled hand and given the special attention that only home bakers are known to give.
Curry  Leaves is one of Colombo's oldest Indian restaurants, but remains mostly under the radar. Their strength lies in their biryani, but the rest of the dishes were pretty ordinary.
Colombo's only drive-through bakery. They've got good ice cream and amazing chocolate fudge cake.
restaurant: The Bakery at the Edge (Waters Edge)

intro: Zen is Zylan boutique hotel's hidden gem of a Japanese restaurant. They made a great first impression on our visit, and we love their new bento boxes.
Yumi Cake is a cute little restaurant that serves awesome desserts - chocolate fudge lovers, this is your haven.
Tasty home-cooked Jaffna style dishes - they do orders in bulk, so ideal for lunch or dinner parties.
Quick Thai serves up pretty good, filling Thai dishes at affordable prices.
This home baker does cake jars, and jars full of all kinds of candy.
Sri Siam on W.A. Silva Mawatha is yet another new Thai restaurant. We had high hopes since it's run by Thai management, but the food just wasn't up to par.
Candle Light Hut is a pretty popular, affordable place for Pakistani biriyani, paratha and meat curries.
Lil' Orbits is an awesome place to go to for your sugar cravings. The prices are alright and the chocolate sauce is gold.
Krishna is a good vegetarian spot for rice and curry and the likes at the Arcade. They're run by the same guys who run Mathura.

Calorie Counter with its emphasis on healthy eating was one of the best new additions to Colombo's restaurant scene in 2015. Now they've gone a  step further and introduced a pretty comprehensive breakfast menu, most of it actually tastes pretty great.
Grand Beijing is another Chinese place around the Kollpity junction that serves up good, authentic dishes at affordable prices.
Itsy Bitsy Cupcakes is another home baker and they're big on covering their cupcakes with huge dollops of icing.
Health Factor is an awesome little restaurant in Kohuwala that cooks up very tasty but healthy meals - at great prices.
Indian Summer is a slightly expensive Indian restaurant, with a great ambience.
If you're looking for a clean, charming and authentic meal in Jaffna, we highly recommend the vegetarian Malayalan Cafe.
Sherry Land is a restaurant and pub in Negombo that offers one of the best cocktail menus we've come across in recent times, with some good food to boot.
Dolce Italia is a new little bakery cum restaurant run by two Italians. They serve pastries and Italian favourites that are both authentic and affordable.
Peace Villa is a little restaurant down Lewis Place, Negombo. The food was actually kind of underwhelming, but they serve a great glass of 'All Milkshake'.
Jeorgie's is a new burger place in Nawala - the burgers are huge (and not so healthy), and the fruit smoothies are amaze.
Pho serves up simple and healthy Vietnamese food. It's not as flavorful as we'd like, but they're very new and we think they'll improve.
We dropped in at the Java Lounge in Bambalapitiya the other day, and it's actually pretty good. They've got an accessible location, good coffee and some awesome desserts.
Foodie-Colombo is a home baker that's good at creamy chocolate frosting cupcakes, and cake popsicles.
The Travelling Food Tuk is a lunch-delivery place - the food is home-made, gourmet even, and the prices not too bad.

address: 9, R. A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 04
intro: Mithuro Cafe does good rice and curry for cheap, and we especially love their 'chicken pieces' rotti.

address: Old Dutch Hospital, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: The Hammock Cafe in the Galle Dutch Hospital has a great location and cool seating, but the food is pretty expensive and mediocre.
Tom Yum specializes in Thai street food. We think it's some of the best Thai around.

address: Old Hospital Building, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: A Minute By Tuk is a little eatery in the Galle Dutch Hospital. The ambience is cool since it's up on a deck, but the food is pricey and just okay.
restaurant: A Minute By Tuk (Galle Dutch Hospital)

intro: Peking Palace in Nawala serves up some decent Sri Lankanized Chinese cuisine at an accessible location.
Cafe Hula Hula near the ramparts of Galle Fort serves good kottu, tasty seafood, and - yay! - we found great eclairs here.
Dairy King is a good place to stop by for ice cream - and fat chocolatey brownies - if you're in Galle Fort.

Rocket Burger is the Galle Fort's only burger specialist.  The patties are well ground and they're usually very generous with stuffing -  you're going to spend Rs. 900 minimum for a burger here though.

address: 67, Small Cross Street, off Church Street, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: Mamas Guest House is a decent place to stop by for rice and curry and other meals in the Galle Fort. It's cosy and you can meet Mama herself.
Their coconut chutney lifts to high heavens an otherwise mediocre array of South Indian staples.
Mayura Hotel serves great rice and curry on banana leaves, and excellent Jaffna crab.
Anzu's restaurant on Marine Drive (Colpetty) is a new and authentic Chinese eating house. While it may not suit everyone, it's a good option for those looking to experience Chinese home cooking.
Sweet Layers is a home baker based in Piliyandala. They offer a range of baked goods, but their pastries are what really sets them apart.

address: Galle Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: The Tuna & The Crab is a mainly Japanese restaurant run by Sri Lanka's top chef Dharshan Munidasa in the Galle Fort. The quality is reliable but not game-changing, and the prices are high.
We order from McDonald's far more than we probably should, but that's because their delivery is efficient, reliable and quite fast!
Cafe Francais is the only and best French restaurant in Colombo. It's expensive but really high quality dining.
The Brick Lane Cookie Company opened up their newest stall in Fort a couple of weeks ago. We tried a bunch of their cookies along with their interesting new additions, and they were all pretty great.
Cakes & Things by Windya is a home baker in Mount Lavinia. Her specialty is theme cakes, but her cupcakes and brownies are pretty great as well.
The Spectrum, formerly known as the Coco Fresh Bar, is a small waffle bar at the Liberty Arcade. The waffles are quite ordinary but they do a solid Milo shake.
The Vu is the rooftop restaurant at The Beach in Negombo. It may be a new venture, but the food is good, the service is excellent and as you'd expect, the view is spectacular.
Sugar Rush is another home-baker who makes some very nice fudgey brownies, and a great creamy lemon cake.
Little Star is a not-so-little bakery in Mount Lavinia with a reputation for their Sri Lankan sweets
Zephyr is a very exciting new restaurant and bar on the Mirissa beach stretch. The food is good, and they've got a great ambience that sticks out from the rest.
EatRight.lk is a delivery site with an exclusively healthy menu, from healthy wraps to healthy kottu. It's also got a lot of info on it to help you stay fit.
Dilmi Roti Shop is one of the many roti shops in Mirissa. They serve chocolate rotis, pineapple rotis, cheese rotis and so on, and their milkshakes are awesome.
This is one of the better beach-side Mirissa restaurants if you want seafood. They also do a super banana & chocolate milkshake.
Tea Triumph is a very cosy tea lounge down Marine Drive - they've existed since 1940, and have a lovely range of quality, locally-brewn tea.
The snack bar at the Lifestyle Gym offers some very healthy drinks and wraps - also, yummy cookies.
Taste of Asia is a very affordable favourite on Galle Road for hoppers and Jaffna food.
Basically a place to have tea with a sweet Japanese auntie. They also sell well-chosen tea leaves. No food unless she gives you a biscuit.
Kinjou is one of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo. Their stuff is as Sri Lankanized as it gets, but it's just okay at best.

address: 91/16B, Midland Mawatha, Wattarappala Road, Mount Lavinia
intro: Saffron and Vanilla is a home baker with international experience - she makes some amazing date cookies, and runs cookery classes.
Life Food is a low key health food stall that manages to keep things healthy and fresh while not compromising on flavour.

address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
intro: Saffron is a popular Iranian stall at Thursday's Good Market in Battaramulla. They serve some great Persian favourites, both sweet and savoury.

address: 225, Visakha Road (at the Galle Road end), Galle Road, Colombo 04
intro: Bombay Sweet Park is a small easily accessible shop in Bamba that does very good samosas and milkshakes - they've also got sweets and rice and curry.
Dodol is a difficult dessert to find easily in Colombo shops - so we were ecstatic to find one that not only makes some but delivers dodol to your home.

address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Colombo Racecourse, Colombo 07
intro: Jeewa's is a great place at the Good Market to have some proper Sri Lankan wraps, roast paan or roti, for cheap.
restaurant: Jeewa's Polos and Kuma's Natural Foods

intro: House of Biriyani is a new biriyani delivery and take out in Kalubowila. They offer good value for money along with a solid roast chicken, but they also have room for improvement.
Really tasty burgers, but not cheap.
Barista is the biggest coffee shop franchise in Colombo. Though their Laksala branch is just as so-so as the others in terms of food and drinks, it's got a lovely park-like ambience.
Hotel de Majestic is one of the oldest kottu-and-biriyani stops on the Bamba Galle Road stretch. It's a popular and easily accessible stopover for biriyani and a quick cold drink.
Foodie Adventure is a home cook in Nawala that does take away and delivery. We tried a bunch of her stuff and pretty much all of it was amazing. Which isn't something we say often.
Kami Maki is one of two Japanese delivery spots in Colombo. The sushi may not be the best in town, but it’s not too bad and the delivery is fast and reliable.
This Japanese stopover is a wonderful addition to Negombo's popular stretch of restaurants. The food and service are great and they've got a sushi conveyor belt in the evenings.
The Chariot, most popular for their branch in Dehiwala, is an accessible and affordable stop for baked goods and rice and curry.
Chinatry is an Sichuan Chinese restaurants.  The punchy, spicy flavors are authentic but still good for the Sri Lankan palate.
Olive Garden is another one of Colombo's many Chinese restaurants. The food is good and affordable, and they've got private rooms if you want to take a big crowd with you.
Terro's Pies and Roasts is a home cook in Dehiwala that bakes some tasty pies and serves up some hearty roast meats. As far as home cooks go, we'd say she's a great pick for savory dishes.

address: Wijerama Temple Rd, Balapitiya, Sri Lanka
intro: The Tangerine is a gem of restaurant hidden away in Balapitiya at Calamansi Cove by Jetwing. As far hotel restaurants go, this is one of the best we've tried in recent times. Delicious food, beautiful presentation and good service.

address: Taj Samudra, 25 Galle Face Center Rd, Colombo 3
intro: Golden Dragon is the completely redone Taj take on Chinese cuisine. It has a stellar ambience and good food.
Anilana is one of Pasikuda's big beachside hotels. They've got killer ambience late in the evening, and they do a very good Jaffna crab curry.
The Coffee Bar by the Grand Hotel is probably the best coffee shop in Nuwara Eliya. They've got a chic little space and an accessible location to go along with some good food and great coffee.
Amaya is one of the big hotels on Pasikuda bay. It's huge, and though looks-wise is a little old school, is still incredibly efficient and ideal for some holiday pampering.

The Colombo Café  is a new competitor in Colombo’s café square off. While the prices of sandwiches and shakes can put your wallet on the endangered list, their Sri Lankan Buffet deal is the best deal we’ve come across.
The Ceylon City Hotel is one of the newer new age hotels in Colombo. It's got good facilities at decent prices.
Schakasz is a little cafe in Kirulapone exclusively for desserts. They've got everything from creme brulee to chocolate ganache cake, in large portions.
Poonie's Kitchen is a wonderful hidden oasis in the Galle Fort. They serve high quality desserts and deliciously prepared dishes at surprisingly good prices.
Praneetha is a small eatery that serves up a great rice and curry with the option of every kind of meat, from prawns to pork.
The Anna Marie Bakery sounds like a place from a Beatrix Potter book. The food might as well be from the books too.
Pilawoos, the biggest players on Colombo's kottu scene, have set up a bigger, more family friendly restaurant on Marine Drive. The kottu and iced milo are still stellar.

Grand Thai is a relatively new Thai restaurant which resides at the former basement of The Grand Hotel. Taking the experience as a whole, we were very impressed. Good food, beautiful interior and some impeccable service.
Rripe is an okay juice bar that offers juices and fruits that are locally grown.

Room Service is one of the more efficient delivery services around. Their delivery charges are higher than most others but they deliver from some high profile restaurants that you can't get otherwise.

address: 25, Taj Samudra Hotel, Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 3
intro: Navratna, the Taj's Indian restaurant, is one of the few great places in the city for an authentic Indian dining experience.
Curry Leaf is the Hilton's Sri Lankan restaurant, and their spread of local cuisine and fresh seafood is top notch. If you can afford the taxes, this is a must try.
Brownie Lovin' is one of Colombo's awesome brownie bakers. The brownies are extremely gooey and chocolatey, and affordable.
Cafe Beverly is a comfortable, affordable dining space in the premises of the Beverly Street shopping complex in Rajagiriya.
Smokey's is a home baker that specializes in delicious brownies at easy prices - and they happen to be completely vegan too.
Ammi's Meaty Delights is a home cook that delivers Sri Lankan style meat dishes. We tried their beef, chicken and pork dishes and they all turned out be very satisfying.
This basic buth kade serves a good rice and curry and sorta specializes in baabath (tripe - ie cow stomach).

address: Good Market (Diyatha Uyana), Polduwa Road, Ethul Kotte, Battaramulla
intro: Hash Deli is an awesome homebaker of cakes that has shot to popularity through Good Market. They make a killer cheesecake.

address: 5th Floor, Setmil Maritime Centre, 256, Srimath Ramanathan Mawatha, Colombo 15
intro: If you make it to the north side, Flag And Whistle is a well-appointed space with a view of the port. They do hearty but expensive German fare.
Miss Whisk is another Colombo home baker,  and she does interesting themed cupcakes and some delicious strawberry tarts.

address: No 100, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia, Sri Lanka.
intro: Seafood Cove is Mt. Lavinia Hotel's seafood restaurant. It has a great location on their private beach front, fast service and reasonably priced, fresh seafood.

address: De Fonseka Road, near Vajira Junction
intro: Latheruma does a really tasty and cheap rice and curry lunch.
The Ocean is the Kingsbury's seafood restaurant. The food is fresh off the ice onto the pan - it's good, and they also do a decent, affordable sashimi.
Ashik was once a popular choice amongst the YAMU staff for their rice and curry. Our latest visit left a negative impact on us though, and here's why.
Tammy is a Colombo home baker that specializes in some unconventional cakes. Her repertoire includes bibikkan, love cake and juggery cake, all of which were excellent.
Aside from their buffet, OZO actually has a pretty good a-la carte menu with an interesting range of dishes from burgers to steak.
Mango & Company is yet another new home baker. What sets M & G apart is their cinnamon rolls which are some of the best we've had in Sri Lanka.
Harpo's has a new stand-alone pizza parlor in Nugegoda. Almost by default it's one of the nicer places in that town now, and it makes for faster delivery to the suburbs - from Kotte to Battaramulla.

Galle Caterers are one of the older caterers in Colombo with quite a large customer-base. We've tried their stuff on numerous occasions and they offer great value for money on top of consistent taste.

address: 1st Floor, 10-02, Old Dutch Hospital, Hospital Street, Galle Fort, Galle
intro: Thai Heritage is one of the many chic little restaurants on the foyers of the Old Dutch Hospital building in the Galle fort. The food though not striving for authenticity, is still alright, and somewhat on par with most fancy diners in the fort.

address: First Floor, Liberty Plaza Podium, Colombo 3
intro: Coffee Bean is slowly turning into Colombo's next Barista - this is the third branch to pop up in the city at another very central location. The coffee and food here taste alright and are pricey as usual, and it's a comfy quiet place to chill out at.
restaurant: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf (Liberty Plaza Podium)

intro: Flavoured at Cinnamon Red, with their lean luxury theme, offers a curated menu with good variations at reasonable prices. They've got a good view of Colombo, tasty mains and excellent desserts, albeit with slightly slow service.
Expensive, but probably the most modernist Sri Lankan cuisine you can get.

address: 11, Global Towers Hotel, Marine Drive, Wellawatta, Colombo 06
intro: Trainspotter at Global Towers is one of the few restaurants that's open 24 hours a day. Unfortunately, the entire experience is mediocre at best.
Fresheta is a small juice bar at the top of Chithra Lane. They serve up some refreshing, tasty juices which really hit the spot on a scorching day.
Flavors is Galadari Hotel's Indian restaurant. Their food is actually pretty decent, but the ambience, or rather the lack of it makes you want to wrap up your meal as fast as possible.

address: 22/5A, Mount Breeze Hotel, Off De Saram Road, Mount Lavinia, Colombo
intro: The Sawadee , a part of Mount Breeze Hotel offers reliable food and service at reasonable prices.
Shahla's Baked Bliss is a home baker who specializes in jars full of toothsome goodies. It's not too pricey and her jars and brownies are top notch.
A simple home cook that serves shelled crab - a real pleasure to eat.
Family Baker is arguably the best mainstream bakery in Mount Lavinia. They've got a great selection of both savories and sweets, which have been consistently tasty time and time again.
Kiri Kade, which humbly began as a milk delivery service is one of the most well established milk delivery services we know of. They still deliver and their milk is still fresh and flavoursome.

address: Ground Floor, No. 30, Sri Mohamed Macan Marker Mawatha, Colombo 3
intro: The Gardenia is Hotel Ramada's main restaurant, and they do a wide range of cuisines, from Italian to Jaffna, that are good value for money.

address: 2, Victoria Place, Elivitiala Mawatha (Baseline Rd), Colombo 8
intro: Flower Gate is a new and very welcome addition to the Sri Lankan Chinese food scene. They may be relatively unknown, but theirs was some of the best Chinese we've had in a while.
BreadTalk has been doing well since its inception despite all the "its-expensive!" cries, but anything for a posh pastry, right?
Indramalee is a little buth kade on Union Place that does good rice and curry and fruit juices.  It's not much for ambience but the fare is reliable.

La Langousterie is a beachside restaurant in Mount Lavinia that's pretty difficult to find. It's not the most sophisticated spot as far as ambience goes, but they offer a varied menu and some decent seafood dishes.
Waves is so good I’d rather it be a secluded seafood jewel tucked at the bottom of Fairline road. The portion are generous and the fares are reasonable.
Macky's is a decent choice for big portions and sloppy, spicy Sri Lankan Chinese, pastas and meats.

Mount Grill is an old restaurant in Mount Lavinia that serves a lot of Sri Lankan favorites. The place looks pretty run down now, but the food is actually quite good, especially some of their meat dishes.
This is truly a chill spot with beanbags, good food, decent WiFi and really smart and friendly staff.
FLOW is a restaurant at the Hilton Residences that serves up  a variety of international and local cuisines.
Tatlers Tea is the usual YAMU tea break spot. It really isn't anything to write home about, but if you visit you just might bump into us!

address: 45 Janadhipathi Mw, Colombo 1 (entrance on Hospital Ln)
intro: &Co is a new pub and restaurant tucked in the Steuart Hotel behind Dutch Hospital. They serve up good, hefty pub fare in a spacious setting.
Serving up waffles out of a food truck, Bencita On Wheels is a convenient take-away option if you travel through Dutugemunu Street.

address: 15, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
intro: Sea Fish is a restaurant that's been around since the '70s, and its dining space still features music and lights from that era. Their seafood is however good, and they also do seafood BBQs in their backyard on request.
The Noodle Monkey is a new cafe on Haig Road by Don Stanley's group. While their food has its merits, they've tried to do too much with the menu and the entire operation lacks direction.
Royal Burger is a very reliable stop on Havelock Road for cheese dripping, affordable burgers and subs. It's a popular lunch option among the RI students in the neighborhood.
Icebair is a small, underrated, Swiss-owned outlet in Negombo with a great, rustic atmosphere.
Nestled among the Torana shops on Galle Road, this little eatery serves up a good fried rice, a hefty chow mein, and quite a range of juices.
This saivar kade does some killer dishes and has earned street cred for being the best in Colombo.
Right on Marine Drive, Marrybrown is a cheaper option for fried chicken and burgers. They're generous with their mayo, and their chicken is all about the crispy skin.

address: GS 4, Ground Floor, Race Course Grand Stand, Reid Avenue, Colombo 07
intro: Tea Breeze is Mackwood's tea bar. They have decent teas, and good waffles.
Dwaraka is a new pure vegetarian Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. Although we ran into a few hiccups, we still walked away pleased with our meal.
ඇලුම්කා කේටර්ස් එකේ කෑමවල තියෙන විශේෂත්වය තමයි ගෙවන මුදලට ලැබෙන කෑම ප‍්‍රමාණයේ විශාලත්වය. ලොකු බඩගින්නක හිටියත් ඒක කාලා ඉවර කරන්න නම් ටිකක් අමාරුයි.
The longstanding 88 Chinese Restaurant has opened up a branch in Dehiwela, serving most items except for all pork dishes.
Rasa Sayang is a new Indian take-out restaurant on Hill St, run by the same management as The Malay Restaurant.
යන එන ගමන් ගොඩවෙලා නිදහසේ කතා බහක යෙදෙන අතරෙ රසම රස ක්ෂණික ආහාර වේලක් රස බලන්න නම් මොරටුව ෆැබ් එක අපූරු තැනක්.

Kate Ryori is a homecook in Colombo that serves up tasty Japanese cuisine at affordable prices with some pretty filling portions to boot. It's a tiny operation, but she's pretty much the only Japanese homecook we know of and it's a great change-up from the usual Japanese restaurants.

address: Galadari Hotel, Ground Level, Fort, Colombo 01
intro: They have okay-ish food, and have an Arabian-Nights-esque deco going on, but have room for vast improvement.
The Governor's Restaurant at the Mount Lavinia Hotel is one of the few hotel restaurants that offers real value for money with their dishes.
Elite's been around Colombo for years, but now they've expanded their service to Wattala as well. They serve Chindian (Chinese and Indian) food.
A new place which specializes in biscuit puddings.
Park Street Trattoria is the newest addition to Park Street's fancy repertoire of restaurants. They've got a beautiful space, but the food has definite room for improvement.
Sushi Kai is the new Japanese restaurant that's taken up the former location of Kami Maki. It may look familiar, but they fall well short when it comes to flavour and quality.
A home-cook that's make seasonal Christmas pudding.
China Manor is a new hotel in Maradana with an authentic Chinese restaurant. Their crispy chicken is amazing.

The aptly-named Flamingo House is the newest—and probably funkiest— addition to Colombo’s restaurant repertoire. The food is inconsistent but interesting, but the excellent cocktails and crazy interior win brownie points.
An attic converted into a cafe, The Stairway is a new spot in the Fort run by a resident. Good rice and curry.
Having been around since 2002, Barista is one of the first coffee shops to have popped up in Colombo.
The Silver Spoon is a quality buth kade in Ratmalana that serves wholesome food at decent prices. (Steer clear of the meat, though)
In Doo Se is an Indian Restaurant situated in Thalawathugoda. It's a wonderful place to enjoy a pure Indian meal with a good service.

Mirissa seems to love its roti, and no one does it better than No.1 Dewmini Roti Shop. It's a small, family-run restaurant that offers an impressive variety of dishes, along with some of the best savoury and sweet rotis we've had.

So Mirissa's got their own Beach Wadiya (though not associated with Colombo's Wadiya). They offer a decent variety of seafood with an emphasis on the day's catch. The execution, however, was inconsistent.
This is a new buth kade off Havelock Road, near Thumulla. It's basically average.
Nelum Kole is a rice-and-curry kade in Boralesgamuwa that provides a convenient and cost-effective lunch spread.
Serving both north and south Indian thalis in addition to a la carte dishes, this all-vegetarian eatery is authentic and affordable — two adjectives we love a little more than others.
Sandwich Factory does a filling take  on western diner favorites.

address: No. 243, Thalawathugoda Road, Wijitha Pura, Pitakotte
intro: Have you tried Hopper Kottu? Mr. Kottu is the place to go.

address: Delivery or pick up from Dehiwela or Bambalapitiya
intro: B's Delights is relatively new, having started up just a couple of months ago. They do cakey brownies with interesting twists.
Open from the crack of dawn till midnight, this is a great, clean rice-and- curry stop with quail on the menu.
Crammed into a congested street in Pettah, Sri Suryas is an unassuming restaurant that serves a mean ghee dosa, among other things.
Try-hard decadence that's not worth your money. Faux fine dining.
From regulars like Nasi Goreng and Mee Goreng, this place also dishes out a pretty great beef rendang.
Atrium is a Japanese/Fast Food restaurant in Thalawathugoda
Cool Berry is where the Juice Bar used to be. Despite their name and the extensive range of juices and smoothies on the menu, they don't have half of it.
Cookies and You claims to deliver Love at First Bite, and they live up to this promise. Their baked goods taste as great as their Instagram feed looks.

Margie's Kitchen is a home cook in Mount Lavinia that specializes in Dutch Burgher and Portuegse influenced local dishes. While they offer a variety of dishes, most of it revolves around pork, and their briliant black pork curry is the coup de grâce.
සුහදශීලි සේවක මඩුල්ලක් ඉන්න නිසා වෙලාව නාස්ති කරගන්නෙ නැතුව රස කෑම වේලක් කන්න නම් පුරහල සෙන්කඩ සලාකා අවන්හල හොඳ තැනක් කියලා කියන්න පුළුවන්.

address: G-09, Crescat Boulevard, Galle Road, Colombo 03
intro: Coco V at Crescat offers the same stuff as the Coco V at Ward Place, but the ambience isn't as chilled out as the other. Their signatures are coffees and cakes.

address: Liberty Plaza, Level 2, 250, R A De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
intro: Authentic biryani at affordable prices, Seasons is only held back by its dismal setting on the deserted second floor of Liberty Plaza.

Reef House Cafe is a small shack of a restaurant on Mount Beach. It's got an undeniably dodgy feel to it, but the food isn't terrible and they do serve booze. That plus the fact that they're open well into the night makes this a popular spot for a meetup.
Montage would have ranked as ok chinese seafood until I uncovered something inside the dish.
London House of Coffee is a new coffee shop located on Gregory's Road serving Ceylon Coffee - roasted in-house.
Cake Whisperer is yet another good Colombo home-baker. They do simple, sweet cupcakes mostly - some of the best butter-cream frosting ones we've had.
Red Snapper is a seafood restaurant at the Dutch Hospital that does a range of crab and lobster preparations. It's a formal dining place that plays a lot of '90s saxophone music and serves OK food.
Though reliable, the tiffin hut doesn't have the tastiest food in Fort.

address: 2, Sir Chittampalam A Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 01
intro: Il Ponte at Hilton is one of the older Italian restaurants in Colombo. It may not be as popular as it was back in the day, but their Italian fare is pretty solid all-round.
Thé Cake is a bakery-cum-mini confectionery outlet located at The Kingsbury. It offers baked goodies and chocolates.

address: 433, P de S Kularatne Mawatha, Colombo 10
intro: The Dhawalagiri is a typical saivar kadey, where you can drop in to get a quick, oily bite. It's in central Maradana, you can't miss it.
We all like the occasional slice of unorthodox pizza. But is Pizza Hut really worth the buck you're paying for it? Somewhat.
Seoul is a bright, sunlit, spanking new addition to the (mostly cheerless) Korean restaurants in the city.
Wonderbar is a sweet-toothed vegan's dream come true. They offer you gluten, sugar, and dairy-free desserts and smoothies,
CocoCeylon is a mysterious business that we spotted only on Instagram. They offer overpriced smoothies and chia puddings.
A YAMU office favourite, Amirthaa in Bamba does a mean Ghee dosa. It also serves Bonda, Jelebi and fresh milk with a dash of tea.
The King Coconut has a tropical vibe  with its roof dotted with coconut fronds and bamboo fences all round. It's also very chilled out, with a great view of the sea and the wind whipping around.
Chop Chop does tasty, generous kottu all day, via drive through or delivery. Win.
The Cake Factory has opened a small cafe on 5th Lane that offers a slightly limited range of their cakes and desserts. The cakes were so-so, but their cheesecake was the real winner.
The Grand is a little coffee shop along the bustling  Colombo Road in Negombo. They serve really good drinks and some killer cheesecake for very decent prices.

address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115, Sir Chittampalam A.Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 02
intro: The Dining Room specializes in international buffets at Cinnamon Lakeside.
MoMo's has an extensive menu ranging from naans to lasagna to seafood and pastas. It has a nice, comfy interior, and is a vibrant space for families.
Oshella is a home cook who specializes in chocolatey desserts. Literally everything we tried was excellent, but her eclairs in particular were the best we've had in Colombo.
Dolce Vita is a rustic and snug little Italian restaurant / café which serves everything from breakfast menus to snazzy drinks, pizzas and gelato.
There's a McDonald's outside of Colombo as well.
You'll be pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breads, biscuits and baked goods at this Jaffna bakery and cafe.
They have a variety of dishes including Sri Lankan, Western, Arab, and Chinese.
Calorie Counter's now in Pelawatta and with it they've introduced a bunch of new healthy dishes and desserts.
This is a somewhat eccentric cafe with great music, interesting decor, and somewhat mediocre food.
Beard Papa's is an international franchise which specializes in cream puffs. The first outlet opened in Japan in 1999.

address: George E de Silva Park, Dalada Veediya, Kandy
intro: Licensed to Grill is a food stall which whips up wraps, burgers, and a couple of grilled items for super reasonable prices.
The Black Cat Café serves up amazing sandwiches, coffee, and fresh fruit juices. They're also a B+B.
Natural Coffee is one of Kandy's most popular coffee shops. They also have macha tea/ milk.

August By Mama Aida’s is the newest addition to Colombo’s Middle Eastern restaurant repertoire. With authentic dishes, exceptional service and a chic, relaxing setting, August looks like it’s here to stay.
You can buy tea powder or tea leaves here, as well as sit down and have a cuppa. They've also got a small selection of pastries at times.
They're supposed to be a tea room, but they serve rice & curry, lamprais and other random stuff.
''ත්‍රී ෆොර්ටි සර්'' මුදල් අයකැමි ගාණ කිව්වා. මගේ බඩ ගින්න එහෙම පිටින්ම නැතුව ගියා. ඒ මොකද කියල මගේ බත් පිඟානෙ ෆොටෝ එක දැක්කාම ඔයාලට තේරෙයි.

Bakes by Bella has come a long way, from starting off as a little home baker to now having a full-blown delicatessen at Alfred House Avenue. They serve up a fantastic brunch menu in addition to a bunch of new treats up for grabs.
Serves coffee, frappes, shakes, and a bunch of baked goodies.
restaurant: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf (Galle Road)

intro: Flow Health Bar is a vegan health food stall in Ward Place that serves up a range of salads and healthy juices. Their stuff is undoubtedly healthy; however, their menu can be a bit confusing and their food just wasn't as flavoursome as we hoped.

address: No. 42, D. S. Senanayake mawatha, Boerlla, Colombo 08
intro: ඒ දවස් වල අපි ආරියබවන් එකෙන් බූන්දි 100කුත් අරන් කෙලින්ම යන්නෙ මැගසින් රෝඩ් පැත්තට. හී... ගිහින් එන කොට අපිත් බූන්දි වගේ. පාට පාට වෙලා!
One of the Fort's quintessential spots for accommodation and breakfast.
මිල ගණන් එක්ක බැලුවාම නම් වාඩි Food එකේ කෑම  වල රස ටිකක් විතර හොඳයි . ඒ වුනාට වැඩිපුර වියදම් කරල සුපිරි කෑම වේලක් කන්න තැනක් හොයන කෙනෙක්ට නම් මේ කඩේ හරියන එකක් නෑ මට හිතෙන්නෙ.

address: Abdul Hameed Street, between Quarry Road and Oilman's Street
intro: A street with a wide variety of food in the center of industrial Colombo. Find everything from mutton brain curry to devilled cuttlefish eggs.

address: 931C,  Ethul Kotte Road (Off Parliament Road), Ethul Kotte
intro: With a great setting, decor and beautiful presentation, Chapter one disappoints when it comes down to execution.

address: 7 Barnes Place Residencies, Barnes Place, Colombo 07
intro: A homebaker based in heart of Colombo 7 who specializes in peanut butter jelly cookies.
Whipping up some mouthwatering Sri Lankan and Western/ Fusion cuisine, Kaduruketha's restaurant is elegant and mouthwatering.

Started by Cherine Amarasinghe and her husband Karu, Cherine’s Quench caters bottles of delicious icy beverages – ice coffee, naarang juice, and gingerbeer. Using all natural ingredients and bottled daily, the drinks are fresh and don’t contain any additives.

address: Nuga Tree Car Park, Racecourse, Colombo 7
intro: Foody Goody, one of Good Market's favourites, sells totally natural, preservative/additive-free ice-cream made at home.

address: Yet another of the Good Market's fabulous finds, the Ceylan Crêperie is a superb nomadic little stall that started up few years ago. The French owner Noémi is effervescent and passionate about her product. Follow her on Facebook or Instagram to know where to find her next and to enjoy her yummy crêpes.
intro: Yet another of the Good Market's fabulous finds, the Ceylan Crêperie is a superb nomadic little stall that started up few years ago. The French owner Noémi is effervescent and passionate about her product. Follow her on Facebook or Instagram to know where to find her next and to enjoy her yummy crêpes.
We heard good things about Spicy Cabin, but our experience simply wasn't that good.
The new Mama's remains a good spot for a beer or lime soda, but for rice and curry it's below average.

Red Fort Restaurant is a small North Indian Restaurant on a small side road just off Baseline Road. The restaurant looks like an old abandoned house with wild grass and a kid’s playground at the front. The place is quite small but the service here is good and all in all, it’s a quaint, comfy place to have a meal.
With straightforward, authentic Neapolitan pizzas made in a wood-fired oven and simple yet chic décor, the family-run Oro 1889 is a treat.
Hotel Top Form is an Indian restaurant under the Nugegoda flyover. It's OK, the lunch packets are not especially good but we hear good things about the tandoori.
EatRite, a part of Susiko Bakers, is working to promote (healthier) rice flour products - which includes local delicacies like milk toffees and kawung.

address: Liberty Arcade, 282, R. A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 03
intro: Raja Bojun is generally known for good Sri Lankan cuisine. They've moved from their old spot near Galle Face to a new location at the top of Liberty Arcade. The food is still good, so is the spread, though nothing amazing. We loved the seafood best.
Local biryani doesn’t seem to get the attention it deserves.  If you think about it though those plates of saffron tinged rice are a central part of life for millions of Sri Lankans.

The Devon Bakeaway is on your left hand side just before the Nugegoda Fly Over (Past Mc Donald’s). The location is ideal, although finding a parking spot can be extremely difficult in this part of town. They mainly do short eats and cakes but their lunchtime menu of biriyani, fried rice and the essential rice and curry bring in a handful of loyal customers.
Sovereign German Restaurant is pretty good. They serve extremely hearty German fare in a kitschy but welcoming location in Nugegoda.
The Gallery Cafe is one of those perpetually hip spots in Colombo. The ambience is one of a kind and the  food is consistently good, but it will leave a dent in your wallet.
Mathura is a decent Indian vegetarian restaurant that has been around Colombo for years, but now at a new location.
Good ambience, decent food, over-rated chili paste. Okay value for groups.
This is a confused place. It's barely got anything to do with chocolate.

Bombay Sweet Mahal is one of many shops selling Indian sweets and fruit juice in Wellawatte. What sets it apart are their special offerings, like the multi-layered fruit cocktail (Rs. 290) and the seasonal durian juice.

It’s June and rambutan-season is just kicking off – those of us who are fans can be seen flocking the pavement of Havelock Road near the BRC Grounds, asking the aiyyas to stuff plastic bags with red and green fruit.
Malay Restaurant in Dehiwala is hugely popular, and after trying our their stuff we can see why. The portions: massive, the flavours: excellent and the prices: reasonable.
One of the oldest Chinese restaurants in Colombo, Chinese Dragon does an okay job.
One of the best views anywhere in the city or the region, in an incredibly under-rated colonial property.
Nana's is the premier dining venue on Colombo’s premier public space, the Galle Face Green. This tented kade is a favourite for kottu and BBQed seafood.
Hazari's has managed to maintain their Middle-Eastern standard while moving to their new Marine Drive location.
Beach Wadiya is an old school beachside restaurant in Wellawatte. The service is fast and the food is good, but not excellent.

address: Cinnamon Grand, Shri Uttarananda Road, Colombo
intro: Whether you're just visiting Colombo or you live here, the Cinnamon Grand Brunch is a must visit. This lavish Sunday luncheon has long been a tradition with many Colombo families who, after church or a Sunday lie in, drive over to spend their afternoon ensconced in the Taprobane restaurant amidst cascading chocolate fountains, silver platters of oysters and glistening legs of lamb.

I can understand the appeal of Aqua to a certain clientele. It's probably a good place for a party. The beach isn't always swimmable, but there's a nice area where you can drinks some cocktails, watch the waves or even lounge in the plunge pool without getting your hair wet. And they play some decent music. But it's certainly not worth travelling too far out of your way for in terms of food.
Siam House serves up reliable and tasty Thai-fare, and they're built for volume and deliveries.
Ministry of Crab is a high-end restaurant on Dutch Hospital premises that specializes in crab cuisine - the food is just plain mouth-watering and the service is good.
Hansa Coffee is a great place for original Hansa coffee and chocolate, and brownies. It's an affordable, cosy coffee lounge.
A good drink, bites and lively conversation all tucked away in Colombo 5 – this is really the club for Colombo’s gentlemen of class and distinction.
As far as safe bets go, Bayleaf is right up there. Good Italian fare at not too exorbitant prices, and a rather extensive menu to choose from.

Rio Ice Cream, a Jaffna franchise that's about forty years old (according to Raja at its Wellawatte branch), is idyllic and affordable for ice cream lovers - they're creative with flavours and mix it up for fun with jelly and smarties, because why not?
Mythi's is a small streetside restaurant on Fife Road that offers arguably the best black pork curry in Colombo, along with a killer rice and curry.
Harpo's is known for their premium pizzas. The delivery though was an arduous process and took way longer than we expected.
Paan Paan is an excellent bread shop off Duplication Road. They've got superb takes on European loaves and pastries.

A whole grilled fish, a pile of garlic drenched prawns, some ice cold bottles of lion larger, the roar of the sea all to yourself on a weekday evening. This is what Haus Chandra/the Boat Haus Cafe offers.

Heaven's Kitchen, which apparently used to be called Hell's Kitchen, is a small but obviously successful bath kade in Rajagiriya, just past the junction down the Borella-Rajagiriya road where it snakes towards Buthgamuwa Road and the Fairmount/Fairway apartments. They have an excellent pork curry.

Dinemore's never struck me as an exceptional place. I've always enjoyed the food and found it tasty, but it's not the kind of place I'd actively choose to go to – it was more of an oh it's just round the corner or grab a quick bite sort of place.

La Rambla is a pleasant little restaurant tucked away down Hotel Road in Mount Lavinia. If you're looking for a quiet, private meal with good food and quick service, this is one we'd recommend. They now exclusively serve up Thai food under the same name and roof.
Tasty Caterers is one of the better bakeries in Colombo. They've got a good range of savouries, and some of the best eclairs in the city.

So another day in our quest for a restaurant (not a hole in the wall/buth kadai) that serves a good rice and curry meal. We had a hot tip on The Angler a small restaurant down Hotel Road just up the road from the Mt Lavinia Hotel. We heard they served up a good homestyle curry with an emphasis on seafood, so expecting delicious piles of squid and prawn curry we rushed down to everyone’s favorite beachside suburb.
Han Gook Gwan does a authentic take on Korean cuisine at a reasonable price. You'll most likely be walking away with a new found love for Korean cuisine.
Ah, Fab. It's been around longer than we can remember - since 1979 to be precise - and has consistently been keeping Colombo happy with their short eats, cakes and sweets.

This place does a decentish bath packet for around Rs. 170. Samba rice, dahl, a couple of vegetables curries (gotakola, beetroot, snake-gourd, etc) and sometimes soya, wrapped up with your choice of chicken or fish

address: Cinnamon Lakeside, 115 Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
intro: Royal Thai is a great celebratory option. With delicious food and impeccable service, it's definitely one of Colombo's reigning dining royalty.

This is one of the more upmarket eating establishments on Vauxhall. It looks clean and professional: tiled and terrazzo floors, glass windows and an extensive, clearly printed menu on the wall. You can order from the menu but most of the food is already prepared: mounds of fried rice, plain samba rice, biriyani, nasi goreng, curries, veg.
Sweet Wishes by Vish is a veteran among Colombo homebakers. Her bakes have survived the test of time and her new stuff and savouries taste delicious.

Park Street Mews Restaurant is one of those select few that have managed to remain relevant and maintain high standards throughout the years. They haven't changed much at all, but we're fine with that since the food is excellent, the service is fast and the unorthodox setting is still quite chic.

Near the mosque on Bauddhaloka Mawatha near Bambalapitiya Junction is my contender for the bath kade that sells one of the best budget lunch packets in Colombo 4 (what the hell, maybe even the whole city!).

address: We’re not huge fans of the French macaron, but they looked so pretty that we gave Munchkin a call and ordered ourselves a box of 10, which included an assortment of vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavours.
intro: We’re not huge fans of the French macaron, but they looked so pretty that we gave Munchkin a call and ordered ourselves a box of 10, which included an assortment of vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavours.
After an initial hiccup, Arabian Knights has bounced back well. The food is nearly back to their former glory, and coupled with the new venue, things are looking up again.
Tiny little cafe with excellent froyo and plenty sandwiches, juices, smoothies, coffee and tea. Roast paan is on point.
The New Majestic Hotel is ironically one of the oldest hotels in Colpetty. How have they been doing since our last visit? Not bad, actually. Not good, but not bad.

On the Attidiya Road, there’s a small spot that has the best vegetarian food I’ve had in Sri Lanka. Perhaps the best Sri Lankan food. For Rs. 150 you get unlimited rice, kos, pollos, eggplant, potato or whatever they have on offer, plus homemade achcharu, lunuthe and papadum.

Indi and Shru have been making an effort to convince me of the merits of Mc Rice. I’ve responded with stubborn scepticism.  I don’t eat McDonalds (it’s not food snobbery, or maybe it is) but I’ll eat anything from the grimmest vaddai on the train to Trinco, to the offaly offerings served behind the butchers at Malay street.

The Bavarian has been around for ages, and is still hugely popular. Change can be a good thing but sometimes when you're doing something right, you should stick to it, and that's exactly what the German Restaurant has done.
‘The Takeaway’ is a good alternative to the nearby Sen Saal as their short-eats are almost half the price. They're great: packed with different flavours and about as fresh as they get.
When it comes to value for money, The Station is pretty difficult to beat. They tick all the right boxes with their ambience, service and food.
Havelock Place Bungalow has got a charming little restaurant with a Barefoot-esque alfresco and good food. The prices aren't too bad, and their home-made ice cream is great.
Shanmugas is one of the older and more reputed vegetarian Indian restaurants. They're definitely pricier than most places but the food is very good and the service is excellent.

address: Dutch Hospital Shopping Precinct, Bank of Ceylon Mawatha, Colombo 1
intro: The Heladiv Tea Club does a relatively affordable range of tasty waffles, sandwiches and teas at the Dutch Hospital. You can also get a decent bottle of wine here for just Rs. 2000.
Sits has been our favourite cake baker for a while. Her chocolate and red velvet cupcakes are some of the best in town.

The Galle Face Hotel is one of Colombo's oldest, best known hotels, established in 1864. Over the years it's provided food and shelter to many a revered name: Yuri Gagarin, John D. Rockefeller, Prince Phillip and Richard Nixon, to name just a few. They've changed over the years and we decided to pop in to see how they're doing.
Nihonbashi is one of our most famous restaurants - they serve the best sushi in the city, fact. This is the place for Japanese fine cuisine.

Sen Saal is another one of Colombo's quick eat places. LikeFab, they serve short eats, cakes, dessert and lamprais. Sen Saal is also a good example of the Sri Lankan love of making things more difficult than they need to be - ordering and paying is a complicated, painful process here.
Elite Indian Restaurant offers a wide range of savory veg and non-veg Indian dishes as well as an array of sweets.

Sugarland is a tiny little bakery in Havelock Town, located behind The Souq.  They sell some very nice cupcakes. These don't come in many flavours - mainly just vanilla and chocolate - but they're all quite good. Simple and sweet, and with some pretty toppings.
Suki's Wok is one of the oldies when it comes to Chinese eateries in Colombo. Nowadays they're mostly into delivery, so we tried it, and they're okay.

Juiceez is pretty good. The staff are quite sweet and obliging, and their fruit is fresh and generally high quality. The menu when compared to Roots, however, is limited. They just do juices, straight up. No mixes, smoothies or health drinks.
I often really want to go to Roots. Because it's hot, and occasionally they give you a really good smoothie. But more often you just get a warm drink and crappy service.

address: No.2, R.A. De Mel Mawatha, Colombo 5
intro: The ice cream was pretty tasty. Creamy not overly synthetic- the fig flavour had the satisfying stickiness of real dried figs and while the cookies and cream didn’t taste exactly like a cookie it was a good ice-creamy impersonation.

address: Galle Road (land-side), opposite Bambalapitiya Station Road, Colombo 4
intro: While the food at Forty Forty (a low-key lunchtime rice and curry spot tucked down a tiny alley opposite Unity Plaza on Galle Road) isn't much to write home about, the setting gives the restaurant a run-down charm.
Amirthaa is a cheap, clean, pure-veg South Indian restaurant in Bambalapitiya. The place gets pretty hectic, but the food is good.
Some of the food at Steamboat is good, but the delivery service and website are a bit of a shambles.

The Boardwalk is our favourite new place for a drink. It's located in a beautiful open area by the Diyawanna Lake, in Battaramulla, You drink under the stars while watching cute little ducks chase each other by the water.

address: 89 Galle Road, Crescat Boulevard (adjacent to the Cinnamon Grand Hotel), Kollupitiya
intro: We liked Sugar Bistro in the past and three years down the line that still hasn't changed. Their food is tasty, they offer a great atmosphere for dining and the service is some of the best you'll experience in Colombo.

Fortune Boat was a wonderful find. It's a Chinese restaurant, hidden just off Independence Square near the newly refurbished Colombo Racecourse. You'd never spot it unless you happened to be walking round there.

Bombay Sweet Centre does an excellent almond milk (Rs. 150) and beef samosa (Rs. 30). The samosa was the best I've had in the city - full of meat and gleaming green chillis, but not stomach unsettlingly spicy. The piece of muscat was just indulgence.

While the location of this short eat van isn't all that, it’s not a bad place to stop and have a quick munch in the sunshine. It's clean, the chap that runs it friendly, and the food stands out next to many of the short-eats I've sampled in town.
The atmosphere of this restaurant may not be inspiring, but the seafood dishes survive the taste test.

The Island Coffee shop is so utterly charming and captures perfectly the spirit of a Colombo that is now slipping from the collective memory - an age where nothing was imported and everything had to be local.
Happy Banana is one of the better known joints in Una, often used as both landmark and collection point - if you find yourself lost, just tell someone to meet you by Happy Banana. You'll be fine.

Cafe Japan is a small home restaurant off Marine Drive in Colpetty that does some pretty great Japanese cuisine. It's the definition of a hidden gem since the place is ridiculously hard to find. They've been around since 2000, but those who know about the place seem to want to keep it to themselves.

168 Sea Food Palace is a veteran among Chinese eateries in Colombo and is still hugely popular among locals. They do a decent take on Sri Lankan Chinese with efficient, but the place looks quite run down now.
The Coffee Bean is a pretty comfortable place to relax at, though the bill can make you rather uncomfortable.

address: 54 Haig Road, Colombo 4, facing Marine Drive
intro: It was with some delight that I heard tales of the Crab Company - the man behind the king of 90's Colombo restaurant Don Stanelys, now delivering export quality crab to your door. Every crab junkies dream - the stuff you want delivered, by someone reliable.
Yaal Restaurant down Marine Drive still serves some very tasty and not-too-pricey food, and their crab curry is still good - though it's their biriyani that blew us away.
The Yarl Eat House is perhaps Sri Lanka's best street-diner, serving spicy crab, prawns, mutton and cuttlefish along with a solid rice and curry, all for a reasonable price.

The Floor By O! has been around for a while now, we've been there before and we find ourselves going back more. With very reasonable prices, competent staff and good music, they seem to know what they're doing.

With both selling their goods on the open market the stage is set for open confrontation. It;s the established Corleones (Il Gelato) vs  the up and coming Tattaglias (Carinos) and of course YAMU is caught in the cross fire.
Greenlands is a budget South-Indian joint that wins for nostalgia.
The VOC is a one of the best places in the city to get lamprais, and we've heard their burgers are pretty good too.

It was with cautious expectations that we visited the Kohuwela Roots. But here, we're happy to say, the service is good and the juices, superb. The little glass cube jutting out of Tisara Plaza is clean and nice; the staff don't stand around gormlessly and they can serve up a swift and delicious cold strawberry juice (Rs. 220).
Saraswathie Lodge is another pure-veg South Indian spot on Galle Rd in Bambalapitiya. The ambience isn't as charming as nearby Greenlands Hotel but the thosai is marginally better.
Don's Deli is a little bakery on Marine Drive that doubles as a favourite spot for lamprais, and they also serve seafood at Fat Crab upstairs.

At the point where Jambugasmulla runs into Old Kesbewa Road lies AMRO Vegetarian Cafe, a little oasis of calm amidst the noisy Nugegoda soundscape. Run by four charming aunties, AMRO serves up your basic kade style Sri Lankan food - except not in a kade.

At the end of Marine drive its a little fenced off patch of land with seating out doors and a small covered structure for cooking between the train tracks and the sea. There are tables just two feet from the ocean and the food is simple but good and reasonably inexpensive. Prawn fried rice with hot butter cuttle fish and lashings of their chili paste comes to less than Rs. 1000/=.
Cafe Eklektik is a little courtyard canteen of sorts inside the German Cultural Center. It's good for lamprais, shorteats, fresh juices and some conversation under the trees.

address: Between Moor's Road and Boswell Place, Marine Drive, Wellawatte
intro: To any sensible Sri Lankan the mere discovery of good fried rice should be a cause of great joy, but a shop dedicating every single drop of its oil, sweat and ajinomoto to the mixed up manna? Well, we we were excited to say the least.
It’s called the swimming club, so this ought to be a good place for a swim - and it is. Apart from splashing it out in the pool, you can also dive into their excellent club-level food.
Nalapaham is for those of you with a sudden mid-day craving for crab - besides the biriyani, idiyapam and kottu, they serve tasty crab, cheap.
Hotel de Pilawoos, one of the many Hotel de Pilawoos, is probably the best Hotel de Pilwaoos in town.

address: 2B De Fonseka Road, Colombo, Sri Lanka
intro: Klassy is a really good pastry shop - reliable for savouries and milk toffees.

Pagoda Tea Rooms is basically the only place to chill out at on Chatham Street - it's in a lovely building from all the way back in 1884. They do a super lamprais, and fun fact: Duran Duran shot a music video here.

Java Lounge in Jawatta has become our go to spot for casual meetings or we just want to grab a quick coffee. They've got an accessible location, some surprisingly good pasta dishes and coffee that hits the spot more often than not.

address: 124, S De S Jayasinghe Road, Kohuwala.
intro: The chicken was excellent, but it took them half an hour so we would have been pretty enraged if it wasn't. The actual biryani though, for us this is the rich saffron and meat infused rice, was disappointing.

Between a Maldivian restaurant and a playground is a strip of sand that leads to a broad beach and the Indian ocean. Lani's decorated fishing boat will be on your left. The entrance is behind the boat.
Min Han (or Ming Han) is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants. It's cheap, super tasty and the waiter Wijapayala orders for you.
Occupying the former Agra bar, Shimmer, the Manchester dons the mantle of the previously Indian themed space, changing pretty much nothing except its name.

Spice is a peculiar yet charming little restaurant located off the dusty, exhaust-filled Galle Road.  Screened by a painted concrete slab, a passing glance from a tuk is likely to overlook the large dining space concealed behind. The restaurant slash kade hiding beyond the colourful wall is housed under an aluminium canopy, held up by scaffolding and corrugated sheets of metal. Despite its minimal structure, however, Spice is really a rather pretty place to sit down for a meal.
An old favourite, Wijaya Beach continues to serve up fresh seafood, excellent pizza and a sun-dappled ocean view.

We've had quite a few new ice cream parlors pop up over the past few years (no complaints from us!), but Il Gelato still reigns supreme when it comes to high quality ice cream. There's just this small issue of having to empty your wallet for a few scoops..

The Roti Stop is a classic down south destination. While there are numerous roti joints dotting the Galle Road by almost every tree and milespost, the Unawatuna Roti Stop is one of the more iconic of our unleavened bread spots.
Coco Veranda on Ward Place is one of Colombo's most popular coffee shops. We loved them in the past, but this time around it was a let down.
Indian Chaat Corner is a tiny barely-noticeable restaurant that specializes in Indian street food. The chaat is still pretty good, and they've got a nicer interior now.

address: Ven. Muruththettuwe Ananda Himi Mawatha, Colombo 5
intro: Lunu Ambula, on Thimbirigasyaya Road, is a buth kade with a rustic feel. Some are decent, others are outstanding.
In Negombo, where you have less ice creamy options (although an Il Gelato is opening up soon), Rio stands as a pleasure dome filled with cool, brightly coloured confections.

address: Juliana Hotel, 316 Galle Road, Kollupitiya, Colombo 3
intro: Kyung Bok Kung at Hotel Juliana does a pretty authentic take on Korean cuisine. The setting might be slightly dubious, and the DIY style might not be for everyone, but order the right dishes and you'll be glad you dropped in.
JU Caterers is an awesome rice & curry place - they combine tasteful ambience with bath kade prices.
Barefoot Cafe is the best place to hang out in Colombo. It's a chilled place to meet or make friends, see art, hear music, eat good food and drink affordable beer.
One of the top Kottu places in Bambalapitiya.

We were recently introduced to the Sugar Shack, run by Aru De Silva. From the looks of Facebook she seems to be one of the younger players emerging on our rapidly growing network of home bakeries. Her menu isn't extensive - no french macarons, meringues or fancy desserts - but she offers a large variety of cupcakes, cakes, brownies and cheesecake.
Colombo's biggest department store's upscale food court area

This little buth kade on Sri Saranankkara Road in Dehiwala is a hidden gem. It doesn't really have a signboard and seats only a cramped eight people, but the family running it serves up consistently tasty rice and curry.
Urban Kitchen is one of the city's newer dining halls. Located right next to Arpico, the lovely, large room serves a variety of cuisines from around the globe.

Chopsticks is a down to earth joint in Nawala serving a vast menu of cheerfully Sri Lankanised Chinese food. Fried rice, devilled chicken, black bean pork and so on - the Sino-Lankan side of the menu is huge, and most of what we devoured was incredibly satisfying

Paradise Road Cafe is one of our favourite haunts, cocooned in a small, white, quiet space atop a lovely store full of antiques and art. The food and coffee are very good, and it's an excellent book nook.
Cafe On The 5th has been a local favourite for years, serving tasty food in a comfortable al fresco style atmosphere. Their quality has taken a nose-dive recently, though.

address: In front of Eye Hospital, Ward Place, Colombo 7
intro: If you're around the ODEL junction (Lipton Circus), right next to the Eye Hospital there's a good petti kade. You can tell because it's busy - a sure sign of promising eats.
